resources.string: No apps found.

"Only popular, free iOS® apps can be matched to Android apps. Most in-app purchases won’t transfer. You can find more apps in the Play Store once setup has been completed.
You may need to give some apps upfront permission to access specific capabilities or information on your device. Permissions are organised into permission groups. By selecting to install these apps, you accept the permissions that are part of each group. A description of each permissions group is provided below.
Some apps may not require accepting permissions upfront. When you use one of these apps, you can allow or deny individual permission before the app uses that type of data.
^1"
By installing each app, you agree with its permissions. Find out more
Back up app data, Wi‑Fi passwords and other settings to Google Drive

"Automatically back up device data (such as Wi-Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) remotely.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is regularly saved remotely. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos."
Stop backing up your Wi‑Fi passwords, bookmarks, other settings and app data, plus delete all copies on Google Drive?

"When you turn on automatic backup:
● Device settings and app data are periodically saved to a private folder in Google Drive. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos.
Large files or files developers have chosen to exclude from the service, will not be backed up.
● Photos and video recordings from this device are synced with your Google Photos library to search, edit, delete and share from any of your devices.
By default, full resolution photos and videos are uploaded. These do not count against your Drive storage quota.
● Contacts and associated data from this device are synced to Google Contacts. You can use the Google Contacts app to search, edit, delete and share contacts from any of your devices.
● Calendar entries and associated data from this device are synced to Google Calendar. You can use the Google Calendar app to search, edit, delete and share entries from any of your devices.
Backup data will not count towards your Drive storage quota."

"When you turn on automatic backup:
● Device settings and app data are periodically saved to a private folder in Google Drive. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos.
Large files or files developers have chosen to exclude from the service, will not be backed up.
● Contacts and associated data from this device are synced to Google Contacts. You can use the Google Contacts app to search, edit, delete and share contacts from any of your devices.
● Calendar entries and associated data from this device are synced to Google Calendar. You can use the Google Calendar app to search, edit, delete and share entries from any of your devices.
Backup data will not count towards your Drive storage quota."
Calendar, contacts, photos and videos are synced to your Google account and may be used across services.
Automatic backup ensures that you can easily restore or switch phones at any time. Find out more

"This will turn off backup for:
Apps and app data Call history Device settings Photos and videos SMS
Calendar and contacts will continue to sync to your Google account. When setup is complete, you can change sync settings by going to "Settings > Accounts > Google.

Events created in Google Calendar will be synced across all devices that are signed into your Google account.
Contacts created in Google Contacts will be synced across all devices that are signed into your Google account.
Backup includes device configuration, such as wallpaper, Wi-Fi passwords and default apps.
Waiting to back up
"Backup includes: \u0009– Apps and apps data \u0009– Call history \u0009– Device settings (including Wi-Fi passwords) \u0009– Google Calendar \u0009– Google Contacts \u0009– SMS"

"Google Calendar, Google Contacts, photos and videos are synced to your Google account and may be used across services.
Sync may be enabled even if backup is turned off. Sync settings can be changed in Settings > Accounts > Google."

"Google Calendar and Google Contacts are synced to your Google account and may be used across services.
Sync may be enabled even if backup is turned off. Sync settings can be changed in Settings > Accounts > Google."
Automatic backup ensures that you can easily restore or switch phones at any time.

"Backup encryption is turned on for your iPhone® device. If you didn’t turn this on yourself, it might have been turned on by your IT admin.
Only photos, music and videos can be copied over. For more information, visit "g.co/datatransferhelp.
I can’t find the adaptor

"Find the Quick Switch Adaptor that came in the same box as your ^1.
Plug the cable into the adaptor."
Connect the adaptor & cable
Unlock your old phone, then plug the adaptor into this phone.

"This is the fastest way to bring over the most data.
Find the adaptor in the box and plug it into your new phone. Connect the phones using a cable, then unlock your old phone."
Just a second…

"To keep receiving SMS messages from iPhone® device users, you'll need to turn off iMessage®.
Visit "g.co/iMessageHelp for instructions.

"On the next screen, you can sign in to your Google account, or create a new one.
If you don’t add your Google account, your iOS Calendar® events won’t transfer."

"Photos stored in iCloud® can't be copied.
To bring these photos to your ^1, install the Google Photos app on your iPhone® device, and turn on Back up & sync. Visit "g.co/datatransferhelp for more instructions.
Google account
Telephone
Body sensors
No account is currently storing backed-up photos
Copied contacts will be saved to your Google account.
Copied contacts and calendars will be saved to your Google account.
Some of your data might not be copied to your ^1. Find out more

"Some data from your old phone can't be copied automatically:
● Downloads (such as PDF files)
● Photos, videos & music stored in hidden folders
● Photos, videos & music received via text message
● Apps that aren't from the Google Play Store
● App data (if the app doesn't use Android backup)
● Certain device settings
● Accounts other than Google accounts (and any associated data)
● Contacts & calendars synced to services other than Google
● Ringtones
For more details and help copying some of this data, visit g.co/datatransferhelp."

"Some data from your old phone can't be copied automatically:
● Apps & app data
● Photos where an original isn't stored on your phone (for example, if the Optimise Storage setting is on, original photos are stored in iCloud®)
● Files & documents stored in iCloud®
● Device settings (such as Wi-Fi passwords & wallpaper)
● Music protected with Digital Rights Management (DRM) protection (for example, iTunes® music purchased before April 2009 or music downloaded for offline listening in a music streaming app)
● Accounts other than Google Accounts (and any associated data)
● Contacts & calendars synced to services other than Google or iCloud®
● Bookmarks from Safari®
iMessage® attachments will be available in Google Photos > Device folders > Message attachments.
For more details and help copying some of this data, visit g.co/datatransferhelp."
